text: Ottilie Stibaner (17 April 1908 – 23 May 1972) was a German chess player. She is a winner of the West Germany Women's Chess Championship (1965). ==Biography== From the 1940s to the early 1970s, Ottilie Stibaner was one of the leading chess players in the West Germany. In 1942, she won silver medal in Germany Women's Chess Championship. Also she won seven medals in West Germany Women's Chess Championships: gold (1965), two silver (1960, 1968) and four bronzes (1947, 1949, 1957, 1971). Ottile Stibaner was twelve-times winner of the Hesse Women's Chess Championship: 1947, 1948, 1949, 1952, 1955, 1957, 1960, 1961, 1963, 1964, 1965 and 1966. In West Germany Women's Chess Bundesliga Ottilie Stibaner played for chess club Schachfreunde Frankfurt 1921.Vereinsgeschichte der Schachfreunde Frankfurt 1921 Ottilie Stibaner played for West Germany in the Women's Chess Olympiad: * In 1966, at second board in the 3rd Chess Olympiad (women) in Oberhausen (+2, =2, -6). ==References== ==External links== * *Ottilie Stibaner chess games at 365Chess.com Category:1908 births Category:1972 deaths Category:Sportspeople from Frankfurt Category:German female chess players Category:Chess Olympiad competitors Category:20th-century chess players
title: Ottilie Stibaner
